rev.comment: /* Resignations from the ruling party and government */
rev.diff:
Line 115: Line 115:
The leader of the [[Yemeni Congregation for Reform]], the largest opposition party in Yemen, Mohammed al-Sabry, stated, "We want constitutional amendments but we want amendments that don't lead to the continuance of the ruler and the inheritance of power to his children."<ref name="afreuters" /> He also doubted Saleh's pledge not to seek re-election. Al-Sabry said Saleh made a promise in 2006 not to run, but then failed to fulfill his pledge.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://apnews.myway.com//article/20110202/D9L4JL1O0.html |title=Yemeni president says he won't seek another term |publisher=Apnews.myway.com |date= |accessdate=2011-02-04}}</ref>
The leader of the [[Yemeni Congregation for Reform]], the largest opposition party in Yemen, Mohammed al-Sabry, stated, "We want constitutional amendments but we want amendments that don't lead to the continuance of the ruler and the inheritance of power to his children."<ref name="afreuters" /> He also doubted Saleh's pledge not to seek re-election. Al-Sabry said Saleh made a promise in 2006 not to run, but then failed to fulfill his pledge.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://apnews.myway.com//article/20110202/D9L4JL1O0.html |title=Yemeni president says he won't seek another term |publisher=Apnews.myway.com |date= |accessdate=2011-02-04}}</ref>
